CatDescriptText: Mr. Earl Scott, postal worker, Schenley Heights and Mr. Ivie Higgins, Homewood, were part of the Pittsburghers Speak Up column, published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, August 11, 1962, pg. 7 with question: "What is the best way to end nuclear testing?"  Mr. Scott's answer reads: "There has to be an agreement first, just an agreement on something.  And then supplemental to this would be an agreement on the nuclear bases which we are supposed to have around Russia.  However, I don't think there ever will be an end to the nuclear bomb teasting."  Mr. Higgins' answer reads: " I think there should be a petition from the citizens to the Secretary of Defense stating the desire that the nuclear bomb testing be stopped."
TitMainTitle: Two frames: Portrait of Earl Scott wearing fedora, standing on Wood Street with Bartek Clothes to Order sign in background, Downtown; Portrait of Ivie Higgins wearing cap, sunglasses, and moustache, standing on Wood Street with Bartek Clothes to Order sign in background, Downtown
